about_the_game:
Main Event: Wrestling Manager is a booking simulator where you can create your own wrestling promotion, hire talent and staff, book matches and compete with other promotions around the world in an attempt to become the greatest wrestling company ever created.

Features

  • Create, Edit & Share rosters, workers, companies, shows and more
  • Book events and shows with in-depth control, including spots, outcomes and storylines
  • Develop homegrown talent or scout for international workers to boost your ratings
  • Create nail-biting rivalries and storylines with our intensity-based system
  • Compete with other promotions around the world to become the best wrestling company in the world



Create your promotion from the ground up, starting with your promotion profile and your company branding. Start your journey with your first few shows to establish yourself in the wrestling world, find your target audience, and gain public attention.

Your starting steps in the industry will determine almost every step on your journey. Coming from a business background means more money to spend on events and workers, whereas a disciplined wrestling background may result in harder, more loyal workers. Will people want to work with you for your money, or to gain your respect? These are all questions you'll have to ask yourself when it comes to building your promotion.



Putting on a show is a lot more than just booking your fantasy match. Before boots even touch the mat, you have to consider location, logistics, ticket prices and more.

Create storylines and rivalries in advance, as well as building prestigious titles, all will quickly prove their worth in booking an incredible event.

Fill matches and segment slots with your signed talent, developmental rookies, or book outsider talent for a one-off pop. Hire a booker to decide the best outcome, or put together the match, outcome, spots, match intention and more, all with their own pros and cons depending on the worker and audience.

Post match analysis will show you what worked, and what didn't, with the ability to see the talent's progress with the company, how over they were with the crowd, as well as how well the event did in general.



Develop and grow your company in a number of different areas; from creating shows for a certain target audience, opening a training school for new talent, to creating and evolving storylines and rivalries.

Target audiences are a heavy part of building any business. Keeping a target audience happy is crucial in keeping the money coming in, whilst exploring new avenues can change the direction and boost growth substantially.

Finding a good training school is important for any up-and-coming wrestler, so why not take advantage and open your own? Training your own talent can be a great way to bring exciting new workers to the ring and have an established relationship with workers regardless of whether they're signed with you or not.

Storylines are arguably the most important thing when it comes to entertainment in wrestling. As your company progresses, you will be able to either outsource a writer for one-off storylines, or even hire your own writers to passively write and unlock potential storylines. Rivalries need to be intense in order to work, so with that in mind, rivalry storylines need to maintain intensity in order to progress. Whilst a good rivalry can really set apart a promotion from their competition, a failed rivalry can really leave a bad reaction when it comes to the fans.

content_descriptors.notes: Combat Sports related violence that may result in blood. Minor use of strong language.
